DOC.brief_summary: Assessment interaction tipranavir/ritonavir ( TPV/RTV ) valaciclovir ( VAL ) , prodrug aciclovir ( ACV )
DOC.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Interaction Study Steady-state Tipranavir/Ritonavir ( TPV/r ) With Single-dose Valaciclovir ( VAL ) Healthy Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Healthy male nonpregnant , nonlactating female subject determine result screen Signed write informed consent accordance Good Clinical Practice ( GCP ) local legislation The ability understand sign write informed consent form , prior participation screening procedure willingness comply study requirement Age > 19 < 59 year ( 20 58 year inclusive ) Weight ≥ 60 kg Body mass index ( BMI ) > 18.5 < 29.9 kg/m2 Any finding medical examination ( include blood pressure , pulse rate , electrocardiogram ) deviate normal clinical relevance Atrioventricular ( AV ) block include 1° Gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunologic , hematological , oncological hormonal disorder Surgery gastrointestinal tract ( except appendectomy ) Diseases central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder neurological disorder Relevant history orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts Chronic relevant acute infection History allergy/hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator Known hypersensitivity TPV , RTV , valaciclovir , aciclovir antiretroviral drug ( market experimental use part clinical research study ) Known elevate liver enzyme past trial compound Intake drug long halflife ( > 24 hour ) ( < 1 month prior administration ) Prescription counter medication ( include vitamin , mineral , herbal supplement antacid ) , dietary supplement 14 day prior study drug administration expect trial ) Participation another trial investigational drug ( < 2 month prior administration expect trial ) Smoker consumption > 10 cigarette > 3 cigar > 3 pipes/day keep tobacco intake constant Alcohol ( > 40 g/day male > 20 g/day female ) drug abuse Blood donation loss > 400 mL , < 3 month prior administration Clinically relevant laboratory abnormality Transaminases reference value history Inability comply dietary regimen study centre For female subject : Pregnancy plan become pregnant within 60 day study completion Positive pregnancy test Have use barrier method contraception least 3 month prior participation study childbearing potential surgically sterilize Are willing unable use reliable method barrier contraception ( diaphragm spermicidal cream/jelly condoms spermicidal foam ) , 2 month completion/termination trial childbearing potential surgically sterilize Chronic use oral contraception hormone replacement contain ethinyl estradiol Breastfeeding
